marker.comment: 33 miles until anchor down at Nuuk(Gadthaab). Seas now fairly calm. ; ;
At Sisimiut- having radio problems but all else well. Happy 4th to all!!!; ;
Still working on radios. This is the 2nd larget town in Gl- 5000 people ; ;
Anchor up 1000-Radios working- Happy 91 Birthday Dad!; ;
Crosssing Disco Bay heading to Jakobshavn. We found the ice! ; ;
Turned back by ice at Ilulisaat. Headed toward Godhavn, Disco Is. ; ;
Anchor down 0145 at Godhavn. A tiptoe thru the icebergs in the fog! ; ;
Anchor down 0025, Aasiaat-Beautiful icebergs under midnight sun!; ;
Aasiaat - No crew arrived today, maybe tomorrow. ; ;
Aasiaat - All of the crew arrived on the noon plane-Nasty storm yesterday ; ;
Upernavik - All well except with our radio; ;
Upernavik - Still working on getting the gremlins out of our radios; ;
Upernavik - The gremllins are the high lat''s and N Lights in Greenland.; ;
Enroute to Devil''s Thumb. Beautiful hugh ice bergs and 24hr daylight ; ;
At Devil''s Thumb. Beautiful hugh ice bergs and 24hr daylight ; ;
Kraulshavn. Too much ice to anchor at Devils Thumb. ; ;
Kraulshavn Waiting for ice to clear in Baffin Bay. Great liittle harbor ; ;
Kraulshavn - Still waiting for the ice. Trying to get clothes washed; ;
In Baffin Bay heading to Canadaand trying to avoid the ice pack
Close to Resolute!!!! Very thing going well except radios
Resolute!!!! Some pack ice but not bad
Resolute - Waiting out winds. Ice still solid in passages ahead
Resolute - Fueled and watered today plus got eggs at $5 a doz.
Resolute - Still waiting for the ice to clear so we can leave!
Trying for Prince Regent Sound:) Hopefully away from Resolute!!
Anchor down Port Leopold, Somerset Is. Ice free- Happy to be here!
Port Leopold - Waiting for ice to clear ahead of us. Peel Sound still full;(
Returning to Erebus Bay
Erebus Bay-Waiting for ice-Polar Bear swam out to check us out! All OK.
Erebus Bay-The bread baking challenge is getting delicious.
Erebus Bay-Moved across the bay because of winds
Erebus Bay-Moved across the bay because of 45K winds
Erebus Bay-Nasty winds peaking in 50's. Still waiting for ice to clear ahead.
Almost to Ft.Ross at Bellot Straits. Will wait for ice in Straits to clear.
Ft.Ross at East end of Bellot Straits. Explored an old Hudson Bay store.
Ft.Ross . Waiting with another boar. 150 miles of ice blocks our way.
Ft.Ross . Some change in for the better in the 150 miles of ice blocking us.
Ft.Ross . Ice reports are getting better. The concern is Alaska
Through the Ballot St. Ice to heavy to move. Polar bear swam past us this AM
Ice still to heavy to move. Wind improving ice conditions.
Heading south - Pond Inlet next
Pond Inlet-Provisions, fuel, showers, laundary. Home to 2000 people.
St Anthony here we come. Beautiful mountain scenery around Pond Inlet.
Bouncy day but making pretty good time.
1076 miles to St Anthony.
885 miles to St Anthony. Calm seas with snow squalls
750 miles to St Anthony approaches. Crossed the Arctic Circle today.
484 miles to St Anthony approches A quiet day
352 miles to St Anthony approches Saw Northern lights-bumpy day
Looking for a hiding place. Storm on the way:(
60 miles from St.Anthony- sitting in a nice little harbor waiting out the storm
In and out of St.Anthony in 4 hrs. Fueled, provisioned, Norfolk next!
Calm day on the Gulf of St Lawrence
Wind on our nose. 965 miles to Norfolk
Wind on our nose. No more mittens onwatch! It's getting warmer!
About the latitude of Mpls. Fairly calm seas and fog.
Calm seas and fog - 635 to Norfolk approaches.
486 miles to Norfolk approches.
491 miles to Norfolk approches. Breath taking golden sunrise this AM.
229 miles to Norfolk approches. Rain and more rain
76 miles to Norfolk approaches.Will have to wait for day light to enter.
Headed into Norfolk!!!!!! More later
Line over at Norfolk at 1400. 10239 miles traveled this trip!!!
On our way to the boat yard for haul out. This is the last update. Good bye!
